main_definition: Qualifying refers to the process or criteria used to determine eligibility, suitability, or requirements for something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to a test that determines if someone meets specific requirements
meanings_and_examples.example: She had to pass a qualifying exam before she could start the program.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Serving as a condition for something or making it possible
meanings_and_examples.example: The high score on his last test served as a qualifying factor in being accepted into college.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Requiring further evaluation to determine suitability, especially in sports competitions
meanings_and_examples.example: His performance was so strong that he qualified for the next round of the tournament.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Determining eligibility or worthiness for an award or benefit
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee will review all applications and determine who qualifies for financial aid.
